Really interesting exhibition about the early impressionist in the Creuse Valley. Lovely space and warm welcome.
Bit out of the way location impossible to get a cab back to RER Station 30 min walk

An exhibition centre.

I went to the Leonardo Da Vinci exhibition and was very disappointed because the models presented were not of all those used in the promotional leaflets and advertisements for the exhibition. I consider this to be misleading and even dishonest advertising in that it creates a completely false expectation. Too bad‚Ä¶ but I give two stars because the reception staff were very nice!

Large and beautiful exhibition space recently rehabilitated. We love its large glass roofs and its beams which bring its industrial past to life. The exhibition on the painters of the Creuse is very rich. There we admire local artists as well as great masters who have come to immortalize the magnificent landscapes of the region.

Place visited during a traveling exhibition on Leonardo da Vinci. Beautiful exhibition full of models and visionary drawings from LDV. The explanations are of very good quality and some models can be used. To do for fans of the Italian artist. Especially since the staff on site are very friendly and professional. Furthermore, it is very pleasant to visit an exhibition without too many people in front of each piece to see.

I went there as a couple to see the exhibition on the Emperor in Legos. Reliving the epics of this great man in this somewhat outdated (but still surprising) form was much more moving than I would have imagined.  I was already a little interested in Napoleon and knew his life, his great moments, but my friend was purely discovering. She is delighted too. Thank you very much to the organizers, you did a great job! Well done !

The exhibitions are well organized. Entrance is free for children, making it easy to bring them along. The teams are available to discuss the exhibition and answer our questions. Nice experience with the 4 children ;)
The new exhibition is very interesting, colorful, varied and well legendary. Too bad not to offer a senior rate.

The Grognard workshop...  First of all, the place, a former industrial building transformed into a place of cultural exhibition and discovery.  The workshop has kept its old style and has been redesigned and modernized to accommodate and showcase the exhibitions in optimal conditions.  The Lek & Sowat Duography exhibition is just fantastic and a treat for the eyes, you have to love Street Art of course.  The numerous and different works exhibited by the duo are well highlighted and in keeping with the location, making this a successful exhibition.  I recommend visiting the exhibition for everyone.6

Cultural place regularly offering excellent exhibitions, currently on Leonardo Da Vinci (until May 12, 2024). Located near the Ch√¢teau de la Malmaison and is served by buses 27, 258, 259 and 503 at the departmental level.
A program always very varied, never disappointed by our visits. Free for under 18s.
Very beautiful exhibitions regularly. Until June 13, visit the one dedicated to Ernest Pignon Ernest
Always interesting exhibitions. Pleasant and efficient staff, Pignon Ernest Pignon exhibition to absolutely discover

Misleading poster, interesting exhibition because everything Leonardo da Vinci did is interesting but inserts are difficult to read, chaos and din with the devices that children can manipulate. We were happy to get out, to escape. Not sure if the guided tour will be audible given the constant noise.
Access is always smooth as far as I'm concerned, I've never had a problem
Very beautiful Napoleon exhibition in Lego Fun and we rediscover history
Very beautiful exhibition space and very pleasant welcome
Really interesting exhibitions. You can take an audio guide.
Pleasant space with varied and interesting exhibitions

Excellent exhibition on the painters of the Creuse, instructive details on the beginnings of this academic trend reproducing landscapes, A small reservation on the figurative part after having seen the first part of the exhibition.
If you want to see the Hom Nguyen exhibition, this is the ideal place.

Pleasant place but poor lighting, whatever the exposure. For the Leonardo da Vinci Expo, typed presentations, too small to read, those on the walls with reflections and unable to be read, certain drawings poorly arranged, too far because behind a stage. Despite everything, the exhibition is very informative.

Usually a culturally enriching place and very interesting to see. Unfortunately for the Leonard de Vinci exhibition, the leaflets did not correspond to reality at all, this is the first time I have seen that the Grognard workshop disappoints me but here I was really very disappointed. There were just a few wooden models, 4 or 5 of which we could touch, but hey... not of much use. Above all, it was a waste of time and a big disappointment. On the other hand, the staff is still as pleasant as ever.

Interesting but does not at all correspond to what is on the poster announcing the exhibition. Miniature reproductions in wood... The genius of Leonardo da Vinci is not reflected in all its grandeur... In addition, this exhibition focused on mechanics is not really suitable for children under 7 who are not know/cannot read the explanations indicated under the objects... Too bad because Leonardo's genius would have allowed a more diversified exhibition... To see once

A beautiful exhibition that keeps its promises. I simply regret the incredible number of spelling errors on the information notices in front of each model. The same goes for the website dedicated to the exhibition, a huge fault still present three days after having reported it during the visit. It‚Äôs intolerable, there are children reading this. A beautiful EXHIBITION on Leonardo de VINCO. Who are we kidding?
Very beautiful exhibition on the bicentenary of Napoleon. My son loved it.
Very nice space. The Leonardo da Vinci Exhibition is very well documented and fun. There is parking right across the street. Really cheap entry.
Former workshop turned exhibition center, it is not the container that is interesting but the content! Beautiful exhibition on rugby on the date of my visit
Very bad time spent during Leonardo da Vinci's visit. That it was not my surprise when I did not see the models presented on the poster. To be strongly avoided. A disgruntled resident of Rueil
Beautiful exhibition on the work of Leonardo da Vinci

Always very beautiful exhibitions, rare to boot, with varied themes and entry really accessible to all. The exhibition choices are eclectic and truly worthy of the great museums. Works rarely released elsewhere are brought together for the pleasure of the curious, informed or newbies. To visit absolutely according to your inspiration!
It's an exhibition of Leonardo da Vinci, Leonardo spent his time inventing war machines. I liked it. I recommend. üòÄ
